column4: so no one wants to try and get sound working for a dell laptop with an i810 chipset?
whip: its an inspiron 8599
snd_intel8x0           35468  0
snd_ac97_codec         67844  1 snd_intel8x0
what hardware are you running? Dell laptop possibly?
edit /etc/modules and remove "lp"
then reboot, and check if lp, parport_pc, or parport are still loaded
which they shouldn't be
if they are, I'll have to tell you how to blacklist them
time to reboot. i'll be back
no lp in /etc/modules
lsmod | grep parport
edit /etc/hotplug/blacklist
add lp, parport, and parport_pc to the end
you are awesp,e
yea, most people don't use the legacy interfaces anymore
while i have your attention, i have another quick question.  my firewire drive wont automount from fstab
that happened under debian woody as well
and how does one go about doing that
ok
alright it came up, now will it come back as that same mount /media/sdb1 every time?
